content.transcript:
External refuse areas must be kept clean and tidy to avoid attracting rodents, birds and insects.

Bins must have tight-fitting lids and should never overflow. They should be waterproof, pest-proof and durable.

Receptacles must be emptied as frequently as necessary and cleaned after emptying. The yard surface must be hosed down regularly to avoid creating a nuisance.

Remember to wash your hands after emptying refuse containers and handling waste.
